_meanings:
{@--4@}
To arrest, stop, catch; <ls>Bg. 6. 35.</ls>

{@--8@} To affect,
seize or possess (as a demon, spirit
&c.); as in {#piSacagfhIta, vetAla#}
{#gfhIta#}.

{@--9@} To assume, take; {#dyutimagrahId#}
{#grahagaRaH#} <ls>Śi. 9. 23</ls>; <ls>Bk. 19. 29.</ls>

{@--13@} To master,
grasp, comprehend; <ls>R. 18. 46.</ls>
{@--19@} To conceive.

{@--20@}
To observe (as a fast).

{@--21@} To
eclipse.

{@--22@} To undertake, 
undergo, begin.

{@--23@} To take up, draw
(water.)
{@--24@} To stop, intercept.
{@--25@} To withdraw, draw back.
{@--26@} To include.

{@--27@} To receive
hospitably (as a guest). [The
senses of this root may be variously
modified according to the noun
with which it is joined].

{@--2@} To give away in 
marriage; <ls>Ku. 1. 52</ls>

{@--3@} To teach, make one
acquainted with.

{@--4@} To make one
take, deliver over to.

to take
away, tear off.

to seize 
forcibly.
To take, receive, &c.
